intro: Lasiocephalus, commonly known as the woolly-headed plant, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Amaranthaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, or pubescent, stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plants typically grow in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to dry conditions. They produce small, often clustered flowers that can be either bisexual or unisexual. Lasiocephalus species are valued for their ornamental appeal and are sometimes cultivated in gardens for their unique appearance.
